intro: Bomarea salsilloides var. pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered bomarea, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence structure. The plant features striking, showy spathes that enclose its small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral morphology and ecological adaptations to high-altitude habitats.
